channel.title: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!
channel.description:
I, and loads of users are into servers below 600. Then, there's the users that are using 667 Loading 7## or 718 loading 7##. Most, not knowing the general idea of how to program a server. No, I'm not good at all, I'm adequate at best. But this gets rather annoying: [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/FRyGk8J.png[/img] After the image I went through all threads..
But I say we need to split the server help and server tutorials sections into 2. 1 for the explosion of new sources, so anything 600+. and (could be a child) one for everything below. Granted it's rare to see a 525, 508 or anything above 474. They are still there.
I mean, why not? -Discuss.

item.title: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

I think there should be some sort of requirement of some Java knowledge before posting in the Server Help section. Because majority of the threads in the section, are usually simple things CMD Errors/where to find a tutorial.

Read full topic
item.source: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!

item.title: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

the elve age:

We’ve had discussions about this in the past, and most believe it’s too high maintenance to not only maintain but to go through and manually split the topics between revisions.

I could understand that coming from a mod/admin point of view… But I don’t see why everyone else would say that.

Jmood:

I would like to see a tag system in place, on a few other forum software like Vb you can have a tag that goes in front of the threads title. Why not have something like that in place?

I don’t think SMF actually has that type of mod for it, from what I’ve seen, that’s why I usually add [PI] or [Renamed] etc to mine as is.

Read full topic
item.source: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!

item.title: I vote for server help/tutorials being split!
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I just ignore the help threads about 718+ servers lol. I’m more of a 317 helper. I know this is never going to happen, but I think there should be some sort of requirement of some Java knowledge before posting in the Server Help section. Because majority of the threads in the section, are usually simple things.

Read full topic
